TEXT: The applicant is a NORP national , born in DATE and living in LOC .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

The applicant was convicted on DATE of conspiracy to deliver counterfeit notes , granted bail and sentenced on DATE to CARDINAL months’ imprisonment . During the trial it emerged that CARDINAL of the jurors had been bribed . The judge discharged the juror and proceeded with the trial , saying that he was reluctant to order a retrial because it would delay the proceedings . According to LANGUAGE law this was not a factor which the judge should have considered in exercising his discretion .

The applicant applied for leave to appeal on DATE . His application was refused on CARDINAL DATE . He made an application to the full ORG for leave to appeal , which was refused on DATE . On DATE he filed a renewed application for leave to appeal . There was a hearing of his application on DATE , when he was granted leave to appeal . On DATE , following a hearing , ORG granted his appeal .

The applicant appealed to ORG for compensation for wrongful conviction and detention . By a letter dated DATE he was informed that under LANGUAGE law there was no general entitlement to recompense for wrongful conviction and that the facts of his case did not entitle him to compensation under the statutory scheme ( section CARDINAL of LAW DATE ) or to an ex gratia payment .

The applicant applied for legal aid to challenge this decision and was refused . His appeal against the refusal of legal aid was dismissed on DATE , on the grounds that he had no reasonable propects of success in the proceedings .
